Key Match Events: The Golden State Warriors won 139-105 against the Philadelphia 76ers
Dennis Schr√∂der made three 3s early, all as part of the Warriors' 22 makes as a team
Pre-Game Insights: Coach Steve Kerr decided to adjust the rotation to a larger opponent, giving Kevon Looney a small stint each half defending Joel Embiid
Kerr said it was an option to play Looney, but he didn't enter until mop-up time
Post-Match Reflections: Stephen Curry said 'Narrowing the roles and the rotation helps everybody. You start to build a little chemistry.'
Kerr credited the two veterans for their acceptance without rattling the cage
Miscellaneous Highlights: Jonathan Kuminga has been playing well, with five-straight great games, including 34-point games back-to-back
Kerr said Kuminga is continuing to break through and understand what his role is and what the team needs from him
Others: The Warriors are 17-16 and still in search of some traction as they get ready to face the Memphis Grizzlies, Sacramento Kings and Miami Heat to close out this six-game homestand
Gary Payton II is expected to step back into a rotation role when he returns
